ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 1-2hours
Usually about 1 hour per week outside class.
2 hours
~1 or 2 the week of a presentation

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: I really like this kind of seminar because we can talk about issues different perspectives in public health. We also can communicate with second-year student, which I think is a great part.
good. i learned a lot.
A good opportunity to practice presentation professional paper
Decent speakers, good to hear lots of state information, though it does seem slightly limiting. Nobody seems to do the reading, which limits any discussion.
Very helpful before seminar lectures. Like the new presentation format
The journal club before every seminar is very good and useful.
I'm glad we got to learn about topics prior to seminars--that was very helpful for formulating questions for the presenters.
Good

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Ying Chen  Dr. Chen is great instructor and she is helpful for our discussion and readings.
Instructor: Ying Chen  Very organized and passionate about the course material. She is the backbone of the seminar and does a great job.
Instructor: Ying Chen  She is really into the journal clubs. I like the form of interaction between the teacher and students.
Instructor: Ying Chen  very good.
Instructor: Ying Chen  Ying is responsive and inspiring.
Instructor: Ying Chen  I'm never quite sure what she wants us to explain from the papers, or what she thinks is the 'most important' part.
Instructor: Ying Chen  She is very nice and enthusiastic. She clearly wants us to enjoy the seminar and makes an effort to keep us all engaged
Instructor: Ying Chen  Dr. Chen is good and responsible.
Instructor: Ying Chen  Good

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes, it's a change to talk with others about your thoughts and communicate with different speakers and classmates.
This course is a real-world, applicable glimpse into environmental health studies and positions. It is very informative and interesting.
Maybe not
The topic could be wider. Right now it seems like there are too many genetic stuffs.
the lectures are wonderful.
Yes. Be prepared your presentation
Student presentations are good, as long as people do the reading. More conversation!
Alternating weeks between journal club and EHS seminar lectures
Good
